title: EU-Latin America Dialogues on Sustainable Food Systems: Workshop Outcomes and Future Cooperation
executive_summary: The European Union (EU) is actively fostering cooperation with Colombia, Ecuador, and Peru to transition towards sustainable food systems, as highlighted in the dialogues held on September 28-29, 2022. These discussions, part of a broader initiative involving multiple Latin American regions, aim to address challenges such as climate change, biodiversity loss, and food waste. Key topics included agroecology, sustainable pesticide use, and strategies for reducing food loss. The dialogues facilitated exchanges between policymakers, public institutions, and private sector representatives, emphasizing shared values and commitments to sustainability. The EU's Farm to Fork Strategy underpins these efforts, promoting an inclusive approach to food system sustainability. Future workshops are planned, including a focus on the Caribbean in February 2023, to further strengthen these collaborative efforts.
characteristics: The EU-Latin America Dialogues focus on sustainable food systems, promoting collaboration among the EU, Colombia, Ecuador, and Peru.
The initiative includes multiple workshops aimed at addressing climate change, biodiversity loss, and environmental degradation.
Key topics discussed include agroecology, sustainable pesticide use, and reducing food loss and waste.
The dialogues aim to build partnerships and share best practices for resilient food systems.
The fourth workshop is planned for February 2023, focusing on the Caribbean region.

Political Actors: Director General for Health and Food Safety (DG SANTE)
Deputy Minister for Policies and Supervision of Agrarian Development, Peru

practical_applications: The "EU - Latin America and the Caribbean Dialogues on Sustainable Food Systems" initiative, which includes a series of sub-regional workshops aimed at promoting sustainable food systems, with three workshops already held in 2022 and a fourth planned for February 2023.

The policy dialogues held on 28-29 September 2022, focusing on sustainable agriculture and food systems, which involved representatives from the EU, Colombia, Ecuador, and Peru, and addressed key challenges such as agroecology, sustainable pesticide use, and food loss and waste.
The implementation of the EU Farm to Fork Strategy as part of the dialogues, which aims to integrate sustainability into all food-related policies and promote sustainable food systems.

Ongoing collaboration and commitment from the EU and Andean countries (Colombia, Ecuador, and Peru) to address food waste, climate change, and enhance the sustainability of food systems through shared values and mutual principles.
commitments: The fourth sub-regional workshop of the "EU - Latin America and the Caribbean Dialogues on Sustainable Food Systems" is scheduled to take place in February 2023.

commitment_details.text: The fourth sub-regional workshop of the "EU - Latin America and the Caribbean Dialogues on Sustainable Food Systems" is scheduled to take place in February 2023.

kpi_list.kpi_text: The fourth workshop will focus on an EU-Caribbean sub-regional dialogue and will take place in February 2023.
kpi_list.target_description: Conduct a workshop focusing on EU-Caribbean dialogue.

kpi_list.kpi_text: The EU Strategy for sustainable food systems outlines how the EU intends to make food systems sustainable and integrate sustainability into all food-related policies.
kpi_list.target_description: Integrate sustainability into all food-related policies.

kpi_list.kpi_text: The parties shared a commitment to continue the dialogue with the aim of building alliances to work together for a transition to more resilient sustainable food systems globally.
kpi_list.target_description: Build alliances for resilient sustainable food systems.

kpi_list.kpi_text: Both days were attended by representatives of the EU, Ministries, public institutions and universities in Colombia, Ecuador and Peru, as well as private sector representatives.
kpi_list.target_description: Engage diverse stakeholders in the dialogue.

kpi_list.kpi_text: Substantial progress was made in understanding the perspectives, mutual principles and opportunities for joint actions to improve and achieve a coordinated response to the key challenges of climate change and sustainability in food systems.
kpi_list.target_description: Achieve a coordinated response to climate change and sustainability challenges.

kpi_list.kpi_text: The EU perspective: The EU Farm to Fork Strategy.
kpi_list.target_description: Promote the EU Farm to Fork Strategy.
kpi_list.measurement_method: Assessment of strategy awareness and implementation

kpi_list.kpi_text: Peru's commitment to addressing food waste and climate change, which includes reducing greenhouse gases, reducing pressure on water and its quality, preserving biodiversity, the health and nutrition of rural communities, and better consumer information.
kpi_list.metric_name: Peru's Climate and Food Waste Commitment
kpi_list.target_description: Address food waste and climate change through various measures.

top_actors.name: European Union
top_actors.justification: The European Union is the primary actor driving the dialogues on sustainable food systems, as it initiates and organizes the workshops and strategies discussed in the text.

top_actors.name: Director General for Health and Food Safety (DG SANTE)
top_actors.justification: As a key representative of the European Commission, the Director General plays a crucial role in articulating the EU's strategies and commitments towards sustainable food systems.

top_actors.name: Colombia
top_actors.justification: Colombia is one of the main participating countries in the dialogues, contributing its perspectives and commitments to sustainable agriculture and food systems.

top_themes.name: Sustainable Food Systems
top_themes.justification: This theme is central to the document's main message, which focuses on the EU's commitment to promoting sustainable food systems in collaboration with Latin American countries. The majority of the content is dedicated to discussing strategies, dialogues, and workshops aimed at achieving sustainability in food production and consumption.

top_themes.name: Bi-regional Cooperation
top_themes.justification: Bi-regional cooperation is crucial as it highlights the collaborative efforts between the EU and Latin American countries. The document emphasizes the importance of partnerships and shared values in addressing challenges related to food systems and sustainability, making this theme highly relevant.

top_themes.name: Global Digital Cooperation
top_themes.justification: While not the primary focus, global digital cooperation is relevant in the context of sustainable development and food systems. The document implies the need for inclusive approaches and strategic partnerships, which can be enhanced through digital cooperation, thus making it strategically important.
